alert.note: Alert for Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:46AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Muscogee and southern Harris Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 545 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Mountain Hill, or 8 miles northeast of Smiths, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Bibb City, Goat Rock Lake, Ellerslie, Edgewood, Flat Rock, Laurel Hills, Green Island Hills, Vista Terrace, Cataula, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Kenwood, Midland, Mountain Hill, Fortson, Mulberry Grove and Lake Harding. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
